result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Pre-trial/scheduling conference on November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:03 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Fox, Defendant Ryan Richard White in court.  Attorney Michael R. Cohen in court for Ryan Richard White. Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Cohen has not reviewed the Information at this time however will proceed with ARGN today as INFO mirrors the complaint. Atty Cohen requests to proceed to ARGN For case 22CF292. Court calls 22CF208 and 22CF292. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Def pleads Not Guilty on both cases. Atty Cohen updates the court. Def has pending charges in another county and request time to address those cases as well. Court schedules during block on 11/10/22. Court approves zoom appearances.

Per SRN. sf

1:52 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Ryan Richard White in court.  Attorney Alec Ballo for  Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Michael R. Cohen in court for Ryan Richard White.  Atty Cohen states they are willing to waive preliminary hearing for today and asking to have this case Judicially transferred to RMW to trail case 22CF208. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Court takes Judicial Notice of underlying file- 22CF208.  Court administratively transfers case to RMW, if break down in negotiations Branch III to take this back. Adjourned at1:56 PM. bph
Preliminary hearing on July 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Status conference on May 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

02:01 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Brian Thomas Smestad, DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson with Intern Kaitlyn Dippolito, DF: Ryan Richard White appeared from jail. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant doesn't qualify for PD. DE has hired Atty Cohen in an underlying case. Bond argument. Court orders bond. Court sets STC. Adjourned  Status conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
